intro: Reseda bracteata, commonly known as the bracted reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Reseda bracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens with well-drained soil.
